intro: Quinchamalium rugosum, commonly known as the roughleaf quinchamalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
